Instruction: Coat chicken in the flour mixture and shake off any excess.

Cook chicken in a skillet with olive oil over medium-high heat until golden brown and cooked through, about 3 to 4 minutes per side. Ensure the internal temperature reaches 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Once done, transfer the chicken to a plate, cover, and keep warm.
Deglaze the skillet by adding white wine and scraping the bottom of the pan, then stir in lemon juice and simmer until reduced by half.

Incorporate the cubed butter into the boiling sauce mixture by swirling and shaking the pan vigorously until the butter is fully dissolved and the sauce thickens. Ensure the butter does not settle in the sauce by continuous movement. Remove the sauce from heat and stir in capers.
Drizzle the lemon-caper sauce over the chicken and serve with lemon wedges.
